1.speaker: PENGUIN
1.japanese: {\an8}僕 ダメなんだ 秋って
1.english: I just can't deal with autumn.

2.speaker: PENGUIN
2.japanese: {\an8}なんだか もの悲しくなってきちゃう

3.speaker: POLAR BEAR
3.japanese: {\an8}そう？ 僕は 日ざしが弱まってきたり
3.english: Really? When the sun doesn't shine as much, and the north wind starts blowing... I get excited about the fact that it's getting cold.

4.speaker: PENGUIN
4.japanese: 普通はものの哀れってものを 感じない
4.english: Wouldn't you usually think about how fleeting everything is?

5.speaker: PENGUIN
5.japanese: そんなのキミだけだよ
5.english: You're the only one that's happy.

6.speaker: PANDA
6.japanese: ねぇねぇ 知ってる

7.speaker: PANDA
7.english: You're gonna be really excited! And there's another one.

8.speaker: PENGUIN
8.japanese: パンダくん 何をそんなにはしゃいでるの
8.english: What are you so excited about, Panda?

9.speaker: PANDA
9.japanese: お菓子がもらえるんだよ

14.speaker: PENGUIN
14.japanese: この話 終わりにしていい

15.speaker: PANDA
15.japanese: だからね 今日は お菓子がもらえる日なんだよ
15.english: I'm trying to tell you that today is a day you get candy.

16.speaker: SASAKO
16.japanese: ハロウィーンのことかな

18.speaker: PENGUIN
18.japanese: よく こんな ふんわりした説明でわかったね
18.english: I'm amazed you were able to get that from this vague explanation.

19.speaker: SASAKO
19.japanese: うちも今 ハロウィーン仕様の飾りになってますよ
19.english: We have Halloween decorations up, as well.

21.speaker: POLAR BEAR
21.japanese: 笹子さん カボチャ友の会に入会したのかと思ったよ
21.english: I thought you had joined the Friends-with-pumpkins group, Miss Sasako. And why is that?

25.speaker: PENGUIN
25.japanese: 笹子さん もうやめてあげよう
25.english: Let's stop right there, Miss Sasako.

26.speaker: PANDA
26.japanese: なんでもいいから 早く お菓子もらいにいこうよ～
26.english: Whatever. Let's just hurry and go get candy!

27.speaker: PANDA
27.japanese: ペンギンさん ペンギンさん

29.speaker: PANDA
29.japanese: ペンギンさん 似合ってるね それ
29.english: You look really good in that, Mr. Penguin.

31.speaker: PANDA
31.japanese: かわいい たわしだね
31.english: What a cute looking scrubbing brush.

32.speaker: PENGUIN
32.japanese: キングペンギンのヒナだよ
32.english: I'm supposed to be a baby king penguin!

33.speaker: PENGUIN
33.japanese: もこもこしてるでしょう

34.speaker: POlAR BEAR
34.japanese: ペンギンさん ペンギンさん

35.speaker: PENGUIN
35.japanese: なに シロクマくん

36.speaker: POLAR BEAR
36.japanese: やっぱり ズボンもはいたほうがいいかな
36.english: Should I have worn pants after all?

37.speaker: PENGUIN
37.japanese: いや… そこは どっちでもいいんじゃない
37.english: I don't think that really matters...

38.speaker: PANDA
38.japanese: グリズリーさん お菓子 ちょうだい
38.english: Give us some candy, Mr. Grizzly! Give! Give! Why the hell would I?

39.speaker: PANDA
39.japanese: 理由は いいから ちょうだい お菓子
39.english: The reason's not important! Just give us candy!

41.speaker: GRIZZLY
41.japanese: 飴玉だのガムだの あるわけねえだろ
41.english: Why would we have candy or gum?

42.speaker: POLAR BEAR
42.japanese: じゃあ… 預金通帳でもいいよ
42.english: Then we'll settle for your bank book.

43.speaker: GRIZZLY
43.english: Like I'd give that to you!

45.speaker: PENGUIN
45.japanese: ビーフジャーキー しぶいな～
45.english: Beef jerky? That's rather stoic. Thank you, Mr. Grizzly.

47.speaker: POLAR BEAR
47.japanese: ありがとう グリズリーくん

48.speaker: GRIZZLY
48.japanese: てめえは やめろって

51.speaker: PANDA
51.japanese: えっ なんでもいいの

52.speaker: PANDA
52.english: I wonder what I should pick?

55.speaker: PANDA
55.japanese: 僕は この 肉球みたいなのがいいな～
55.english: I want these things that look like paws.

57.speaker: TIGER
57.japanese: お勘定は ご一緒で
57.english: Will this all be on one check?

59.speaker: PANDA
59.japanese: お金 取るなんてね～
59.english: Who knew we'd have to pay.

60.speaker: PENGUIN
60.japanese: いや 僕もどうかしてたけど

61.speaker: PENGUIN
61.japanese: お店 入って お金 払わないほうが ありえないよ
61.english: It's only obvious that we'd have to pay for something in a store.

62.speaker: POLAR BEAR
62.english: The red bean filling is delicious.

63.speaker: POLAR BEAR
63.japanese: うちでも出そうかな アンコもの
63.english: Maybe I should serve something with red bean at the café.

66.speaker: PENGUIN
66.japanese: もう… っていうか 仮装しすぎでしょう
66.english: Jeez. More importantly, aren't you excessively changing costumes?

69.speaker: PENGUIN
69.japanese: 結構 苦労してんだね

70.speaker: PANDA
70.japanese: ペンギンさんの甥っ子さんたちだ
70.english: It's your nephew and his friend.

72.speaker: PENGUIN
72.japanese: おぉ お菓子いっぱいだね
72.english: Wow, you've got quite a bit of candy there.

73.speaker: BABY E
73.japanese: え～っと… おじさん あげる
73.english: Let's see... Here you go, Uncle. For you. Thank you.

74.speaker: PENGUIN
74.japanese: ごめん… あんまり見ないで
74.english: Sorry, could you not stare at me like that?

77.speaker: PENGUIN
77.japanese: 僕… なんで この仮装にしちゃったのかな
77.english: I wonder why I even picked this costume.

78.speaker: PANDA
78.japanese: お菓子 いっぱいだね
78.english: This is a lot of candy.

79.speaker: PANDA
79.japanese: あの子たちと なにが違うんだろう
79.english: I wonder what's so different between us and them?

80.speaker: PENGUIN
80.japanese: そりゃ まあ かわいさじゃない

81.speaker: PANDA
81.japanese: 僕だって 前代未聞のかわいさでしょ
81.english: But my cuteness is unprecedented, too, isn't it?

82.speaker: PENGUIN
82.japanese: あの２人は邪念のない 無意識のかわいさだよ
82.english: Their cuteness is unconscious and free of wicked thoughts.

83.speaker: PANDA
83.japanese: よ～し 僕も お菓子もらえるように
83.english: All right! I'll work on making my cuteness unconscious,

84.speaker: PANDA
84.japanese: 無意識のかわいさを目指すよ
84.english: so I can get more candy!

85.speaker: PENGUIN
85.japanese: すでに邪念だらけだよね

87.speaker: PENGUIN
87.japanese: シロクマくん なにやってんの

89.speaker: LLAMA
89.japanese: 好きなものを 持っていってください

90.speaker: PENGUIN
90.japanese: 気持は嬉しいんだけど…

91.speaker: LLAMA
91.japanese: 丹精込めて育てた盆栽です
91.english: I put a lot of effort into these bonsai.

92.speaker: LLAMA
92.japanese: いい機会ですから お譲りしますよ
92.english: This is a great opportunity, so I'll let you borrow some.

93.speaker: PENGUIN
93.english: This is a little too deep for me... If I had to choose... How about this one?

94.speaker: LLAMA
94.japanese: あぁ… ちょっと待ってください

95.speaker: LLAMA
95.japanese: 枝ぶりが いまひとつ
95.english: The branches need a little work. This shape is indescribable.

96.speaker: LLAMA
96.japanese: どうですか 皆さんも一緒に つまんでいきませんか
96.english: How about it? Would you all like to prune them, as well?

97.speaker: PENGUIN
97.japanese: いや… 今日は よしておくよ
97.english: No, not today. Leave it to me!

98.speaker: PANDA
98.japanese: わぁ いっぱい欲しいなぁ

99.speaker: PENGUIN
99.japanese: ほんと コアリクイくん

100.speaker: ANTEATER
100.japanese: ちょうど うごめいているのがいるよ ５，０００匹ほど
100.english: There's just about 5,000 of them wriggling about!

104.speaker: ANTEATER
104.japanese: 黒じゃなくて 白もいるよ

107.speaker: PENGUIN
107.japanese: うごめかないのは いいけど…
107.english: At least it's not wriggling about.

108.speaker: POLAR BEAR
108.japanese: 知ってる 缶コーヒーに含まれるカロリーは
108.english: Did you know? The calories in a can of coffee

109.speaker: POLAR BEAR
109.japanese: だいたい アリ １，８００匹分なんだって

110.speaker: PENGUIN
110.japanese: そういう言いかたよして
110.english: Could you not explain it that way?

111.speaker: TORTOISE
111.english: Hal... lo... ween? That's right, Tortoise. I'll go get some now.

113.speaker: TORTOISE
113.japanese: よいしょ～ よいしょ～

116.speaker: PENGUIN
116.japanese: これはさぁ… アイスクリームっていうより…
116.english: You know, this isn't really ice cream, but rather...

118.speaker: MANDRILL
118.japanese: どうぞ どうぞ 上がっていってください
118.english: Please, please, come in! Close, close, way too close.

119.speaker: MANDRILL
119.japanese: どうぞ どうぞ つまらないものですが
119.english: Please, please. It's not much, but... Close, too close.

120.speaker: MANDRILL
120.japanese: 最近 ぬか漬けに凝ってるんです
120.english: Making pickles has been my hobby lately.

122.speaker: PANDA
122.japanese: お菓子が欲しいのになぁ…

123.speaker: PENGUIN
123.japanese: 違うよね これハロウィーンじゃないよね
123.english: This isn't right, is it? We can't really call this Halloween, can we?

124.speaker: BABY E
124.japanese: うわぁ～い うわぁ～い

125.speaker: PANDA MAMA
125.japanese: {\an8}ほんと 今日はいい日だわ
125.english: My, today is a wonderful day. Yay!

127.speaker: PANDA MAMA
127.japanese: 行く先々で 粗品がもらえるなんてねぇ
127.english: To think we got free items everywhere we went.

128.speaker: KING PENGUIN
128.japanese: こんなに いっぱいもらっちゃったわ

129.speaker: PANDA MAMA
129.japanese: ハロウィーンって いいわねぇ

131.speaker: PENGUIN
131.japanese: あの人たち… なにを目指してるんだろう
131.english: I wonder what they're going for.

132.speaker: PANDA
132.japanese: これ… もう一回行って お菓子に変えてもらう
132.english: Should we go back and try to exchange this for candy?

134.speaker: POLAR BEAR
134.japanese: もらうんじゃなくて あげてみる
134.english: Instead of receiving, why don't we try giving?

136.speaker: SASAKO
136.japanese: あれ 何ももらわなかったんですか

137.speaker: PENGUIN
137.japanese: もらって それから…

140.speaker: HANDA
140.english: What the heck is all this?

141.speaker: HANDA
141.japanese: 半田さんへあげます 笹子より
141.english: "To Mr. Handa, This is for you. From Sasako."

143.speaker: PANDA
143.japanese: きっと 半田さん大喜びだね
143.english: I bet Mr. Handa's really happy.

144.speaker: PENGUIN
144.japanese: まぁ でも レシートは いらなかったんじゃない
144.english: Yeah, well... He probably didn't need the receipt.

145.speaker: LADY
145.japanese: 疲れたけど楽しかったね
145.english: I'm a little tired, but it was a lot of fun. It's good that we got to see everything.

147.speaker: LLAMA
147.japanese: お客様は ラマコーナーには いらっしゃいませんでした
147.english: You didn't visit the Llama Corner.

148.speaker: LLAMA
148.japanese: 今も通り過ぎようとしています
148.english: Even now, you're trying to pass by.

151.speaker: LLAMA
151.japanese: ラマデーの設置を求めます
151.english: I'd like to establish a Llama Day.

152.speaker: PANDA
152.japanese: な～に そのラマデーって

155.speaker: LLAMA
155.japanese: ラマのラマによる ラマのための日です
155.english: A day for llamas, made by llamas for llamas.

156.speaker: HANDA
156.japanese: えっと… なんでラマデーを設けるの
156.english: Um... Why are we creating a Llama Day?

157.speaker: LLAMA
157.japanese: 日ごろ ラマがあまりに
157.english: Because I feel that llamas are being treated too apathetically.

160.speaker: LLAMA
160.english: That would be a rice ball {\i1}(onigiri){\i0}. Delicious!

165.speaker: HANDA
165.japanese: お客さんが あまり ラマさんを 気にかけないってことかな
165.english: I guess he means that the customers don't pay much attention to him.

166.speaker: KOALA
166.japanese: ラマさんって そんなに人気なかったの
166.english: Were you that unpopular, Mr. Llama?

167.speaker: PANDA
167.japanese: 地味だもんね ラマさん
167.english: That's because you're so dull, Mr. Llama.

168.speaker: LLAMA
168.japanese: 素直な意見 ありがとうございます
168.english: Thank you for your honest opinion.

169.speaker: FT PANDA
169.japanese: そういえば ラマさんって 動物園のどこにいるんだっけ
169.english: Come to think of it, where are you located in the zoo, Mr. Llama?

170.speaker: BADGER
170.japanese: パンダコーナーの隣ですよ
170.english: Right next to the Panda Corner.

171.speaker: ANTEATER
171.japanese: 違うよ たしかあそこ食堂の脇だよ
171.english: No! I think it's by the restaurant.

172.speaker: KOALA
172.japanese: いやいや 裏門のそばだよ
172.english: No, no. It's right by the back gate.

175.speaker: KIRINO
175.english: He's right next to Mr. Giraffe.

176.speaker: KIRINO
176.japanese: みんな なんで覚えてないの
176.english: Why don't any of you remember?

177.speaker: MANDRILL
177.japanese: 問題解決 お疲れさまでした
177.english: Problem solved! Thanks for all your hard work!

178.speaker: ANIMALS
178.japanese: いやぁ よかった よかった

179.speaker: LLAMA
179.japanese: あの だから ラマコーナーがどこかの話じゃなくて…
179.english: Um, we weren't talking about where the Llama Corner is...

180.speaker: LLAMA
180.japanese: では 会議を再開します

183.speaker: TAPIR
183.japanese: みんな 場所がわからないから
183.english: Perhaps no one visits you because they

184.japanese: ラマさんのとこに 行かないんじゃない

185.speaker: TAPIR
185.english: Why don't you put up a sign?

187.speaker: HANDA
187.japanese: なんか ラマしかいない 動物園に見えない
187.english: Um... Wouldn't it look like you were the only one at our zoo?

188.speaker: LLAMA
188.japanese: いいですね ラマだけの動物園
188.english: What a wonderful idea, a zoo with just me.

190.speaker: PANDA
190.japanese: いいね～ ラマさん以外 みんなお休み
190.english: That sounds great! That means everyone else would be off!

191.speaker: MANDRILL
191.japanese: そんなことしたら 誰も来ないかもね
191.english: But then no one might come.

193.speaker: LLAMA
193.japanese: ものすごく ストレートな意見 ありがとうございます
193.english: Thank you for your brutally honest opinion.

194.speaker: HANDA
194.japanese: やっぱ 大勢いたほうがいいよね
194.english: I think it's better if we have a lot of animals.

195.speaker: LLAMA
195.japanese: では 皆さんで ラマになるのはどうでしょう
195.english: Then how about everyone becomes a llama?

196.speaker: PANDA
196.japanese: 僕のラマ かわいくない
196.english: Aren't I cute as a llama?

197.speaker: ANTEATER
197.japanese: ゾウガメさんのラマも 味わいがあるよ
197.english: Your llama is great, too, Mr. Tortoise!

199.speaker: KIRINO
199.japanese: ラマさんのラマって わけわかんないですよ
199.english: I don't see the point in you wearing a llama costume, Mr. Llama.

200.speaker: HANDA
200.japanese: ラマさんの セールスポイントって何かない
200.english: Do you have a sales point, Mr. Llama? Oh!

202.speaker: LLAMA
202.japanese: 僕 盆栽をたしなみますよ
202.english: I have an interest in bonsai.

203.speaker: KIRINO
203.japanese: でも それも 結局地味ですね

205.speaker: KIRINO
205.japanese: いや その… マイナスにマイナスをかけると
205.english: Uh, I mean... Usually, crossing two negatives makes a positive,

206.speaker: KIRINO
206.japanese: 地味に地味をかけても 派手にはならないというか…
206.english: but two dull things don't make something fancy... Right?

208.speaker: HANDA
208.japanese: これはいるね ラマデー 猛プッシュで
208.english: We do need a Llama Day and we need to really push it.

209.speaker: PANDA
209.japanese: プッシュって 何をするの

210.speaker: MANDRILL
210.japanese: ラマさんを見たくて見たくて たまらなくなるような ことだよね
210.english: We have to make it so people will be dying to see Mr. Llama, right?

214.speaker: KIRINO
214.japanese: それはアナグマくんだけが 嬉しいかな
214.english: I think you'd be the only one who'd appreciate that, Badger.

215.speaker: MANDRILL
215.japanese: 見た人限定で フィギュアをプレゼントっていうのは
215.english: How about giving out figures to only people who visit him?

217.speaker: PANDA
217.japanese: やっぱり 僕のでしょ
217.english: Of me, of course. You'll receive a limited edition figure of me just for glancing at Mr. Llama.

218.speaker: LLAMA
218.japanese: 僕のほうは ついでですか

219.speaker: KOALA
219.japanese: じゃあ ラマさんを見たら
219.english: Then how about you get to take a commemorative picture if you go see Mr. Llama?

222.speaker: LLAMA
222.japanese: それ 僕いらないですよね
222.english: I'm not really needed there, am I?

223.speaker: KIRINO
223.japanese: どうでしょう ラマデーに向けて

224.speaker: KIRINO
224.japanese: みんな アイデアを 考えてくるっていうのは
224.english: time to think up ideas for Llama Day? I think that's a good idea.

226.speaker: TORTOISE
226.english: Agree— So you had a meeting about that...

227.speaker: SASAKO
227.japanese: ラマさんが お友達を誘って
227.english: How about you invite a friend

228.japanese: 一緒に何かするっていうのは どうですか
228.english: to do something with you, Mr. Llama?

230.speaker: LLAMA
230.english: A friend? Well, I do like Mr. Alpaca.

231.speaker: GIRL1
231.japanese: あぁ ちょっと あれ見て

233.speaker: GIRL
233.japanese: ね 写メ撮ろう 写メ

234.speaker: GIRL
234.japanese: アルパカ 超かわいい

238.speaker: GIRL2
238.japanese: そう言われると違うかも
238.english: Now that you mention it, you are different.

242.speaker: GIRL
242.english: Yeah. The few people that do come to visit me, nine times out of ten,

243.japanese: 僕のことアルパカだと 勘違いしてるんですよ
243.english: are there because they mistook me for an alpaca.

245.speaker: LLAMA
245.japanese: パンダくん 確率の話です

246.speaker: POLAR BEAR
246.japanese: じゃあ みんなで ラクダチームってことにしたら
246.english: Then why don't you all make a team of camels?

247.speaker: POLAR BEAR
247.japanese: ラマだの アルパカだの 気にならなくなるかも
247.english: Maybe they won't be concerned with llamas or alpacas then?

248.speaker: PENGUIN
248.japanese: シロクマくん 簡単にひとくくりにしないでよ
248.english: Don't wrap it up so easily, Polar Bear!

249.speaker: PENGUIN
249.japanese: アイデンティティーってものが あるんだから

250.speaker: POLAR BEAR
250.english: Oh, is that so? I don't really understand.

251.speaker: PANDA
251.japanese: ほら 僕らオンリーワンだから
251.english: You know, since we're one of a kind.

252.speaker: PENGUIN
252.english: You guys... It must be nice. Neither of you look like anyone else, so you're never mistaken for someone else.

253.speaker: SASAKO
253.japanese: 似てて困るんですから
253.english: Well, since it's troublesome to look alike,

254.speaker: SASAKO
254.japanese: 何か違いをアピールしましょうよ

256.speaker: PANDA
256.japanese: ラマさんは 茶色くて
256.english: Mr. Llama is brown, and Mr. Alpaca is white.

257.speaker: PENGUIN
257.japanese: 茶色いアルパカだっているよ
257.english: But there are brown alpacas, too.

258.speaker: PANDA
258.japanese: 人気あるほうが アルパカさん
258.english: Mr. Alpaca is the popular one.

259.speaker: POLAR BEAR
259.japanese: 地味なほうが ラマさん
259.english: Mr. Llama is the dull one.

260.speaker: PENGUIN
260.japanese: それ アピールになってないよね
260.english: I don't think that's considered a highlight.

261.speaker: POLAR BEAR
261.japanese: じゃあ フレッシュさを アピールっていうのは

263.speaker: SASAKO
263.japanese: いいんじゃないですかね
263.english: I think that's a great idea.

264.speaker: SASAKO
264.japanese: グレープフルーツジュースっていうのと 生グレープフルーツジュースじゃ
264.english: There's a huge difference between grapefruit juice

265.speaker: SASAKO
265.japanese: 全然感じが違いますよ

267.speaker: PENGUIN
267.japanese: 夏の冷やし中華みたいだよ
267.english: It almost seems like chilled ramen in the summer time.

268.speaker: LLAMA
268.japanese: 冬になったら どうするんですか

270.speaker: PENGUIN
270.japanese: 休んじゃ ダメじゃない
270.english: I don't think that's a good idea.

271.speaker: HANDA
271.japanese: いろいろ考えたんだけど
271.english: I've been giving it a lot of thought.

272.speaker: HANDA
272.japanese: 行動展示はどうだろう

274.speaker: HANDA
274.japanese: ラマさんに 自然体で行動してもらって
274.english: We'll have you act like you usually do

275.speaker: HANDA
275.japanese: 生まれ持った特徴や能力
275.english: so people can see your natural born features and abilities

276.speaker: HANDA
276.japanese: 暮らし方を見てもらうんだよ
276.english: as well as how you live.

278.speaker: FT PANDA
278.japanese: ラマさんの生き様を見せるってわけだ
278.english: So you'll be showing how Mr. Llama lives.

280.speaker: HANDA
280.japanese: ラマさんって こういうラマなんだってことを知ってもらうんだよ
280.english: We'll have people know exactly what kind of llama you are.

282.speaker: ANIMALS
282.english: Let's do it! We should do everything we can.

283.speaker: HANDA
283.japanese: ラマデーなんでしょ 頑張ろうよ
283.english: It's Llama Day, right? Let's give it our all.

284.speaker: HANDA
284.japanese: そもそも ラマさんって どういうラマ
284.english: So exactly what kind of llama are you?

286.speaker: LLAMA
286.japanese: たくさん 草を食べていました…
286.english: I ate a lot of grass.

287.speaker: LLAMA
287.japanese: そして 大きくなった 今…

288.speaker: LLAMA
288.english: I eat grass. I eat... grass, too...

289.speaker: MANDRILL
289.japanese: インパクトに欠けるよね…

290.speaker: KIRINO
290.japanese: じゃあ 僕らがラマさんをどう見ているか
290.english: How about we all discuss how we see Mr. Llama?

291.speaker: PANDA
291.japanese: アルパカさんより 茶色い
291.english: He's more brown than Mr. Alpaca.

292.speaker: KOALA
292.japanese: アルパカさんより 耳が長い
292.english: His ears are longer than Mr. Alpaca. His eyelashes are about the same length as Mr. Alpaca's.

293.speaker: HANDA
293.japanese: アルパカさんとの比較じゃなくて…
293.english: We didn't mean comparisons with Mr. Alpaca.

298.speaker: TORTOISE
298.english: He... is... po... lite... How about something that stands out more?

299.speaker: HANDA
299.japanese: ラマさんも遠慮してないで… 何か ない
299.english: You don't need to hold back, Mr. Llama. What do you think?

301.speaker: LLAMA
301.japanese: ひっそり 山岳地帯で暮らすのが好きです
301.english: I like to live quietly in the mountains.

302.speaker: PANDA
302.japanese: じゃあ ラマデーいらなくない
302.english: Then do we really need a Llama Day?

303.speaker: LLAMA
303.japanese: ひっそりと目立ちたいです
303.english: I'd like to quietly stand out.

305.speaker: TAPIR
305.english: Oh, I just remembered. You're really good at spitting, aren't you?

306.speaker: LLAMA
306.japanese: それは 封印しています

307.speaker: TAPIR
307.japanese: そこを プッシュしていこうよ

309.speaker: HANDA
309.japanese: お客さんに 迷惑かかるのはまずいね
309.english: It's not a good idea to trouble the customers...

310.speaker: KIRINO
310.japanese: パレードだったら どうですか

311.speaker: KIRINO
311.japanese: 何もしなくていいし 歩くだけ
311.english: You don't really have to do anything, just walk.

312.speaker: KOALA
312.japanese: ラマティカルパレード

313.speaker: LLAMA
313.japanese: 僕は どこでしょう

315.speaker: FT PANDA
315.japanese: ラマさんいなくてもできるよね  パレード
315.english: We could probably do a parade even without Mr. Llama.

316.speaker: LLAMA
316.japanese: 何か自慢できるものが 僕にあればいいんですが…
316.english: If there was only something I could be proud of... I got it!

317.speaker: PENGUIN
317.japanese: ラマデーって結局 何やるんだろう
317.english: I wonder what they actually do on Llama Day.

318.speaker: POLAR BEAR
318.japanese: まあ 行ってみよう
318.english: Well, let's go see. Hello. Welcome.

319.speaker: PENGUIN
319.japanese: あれ いつもどおりだよね

320.speaker: POLAR BEAR
320.japanese: ラマデー 何をしてるの
320.english: What are you doing for Llama Day?

325.speaker: POLAR BEAR
325.japanese: きらめいてるね ラマさん

326.speaker: PANDA
326.japanese: ペンギンさん ぺんぎんさん

328.speaker: PANDA
328.japanese: 一生使い切れないお金ってどこでもらえると思う
328.english: Where do you think you can get more money than you'll ever be able to use?

330.speaker: PANDA
330.japanese: じゃあ 僕とメジャーリガーみたいに年俸契約結ばない
330.english: Then how about we make an annual salary contract like a major leaguer?

331.speaker: PENGUIN
331.japanese: 僕が君と年俸契約する理由が見つからないんだけど
331.english: I can't think of a reason to make an annual salary contract with you.

332.speaker: PANDA
332.japanese: じゃあ 年俸くれるだけてもいいよ
332.english: Then you can just give me an annual salary.

333.speaker: PENGUIN
333.japanese: メジャー気分って言うとnoだね
333.english: My major feeling on that would be a no.

335.speaker: POLAR BEAR
335.japanese: 来週のしろくまカフェは

336.speaker: POLAR BEAR
336.english: will be presented to you if we can.
